intro: Ainsliaea grossedentata, commonly known as the broad-toothed ainsliaea, is a flowering plant native to the southeastern United States. It belongs to the Rubiaceae family, which includes many ornamental and medicinal plants. The plant is characterized by its showy, pink to red flowers that bloom in late spring to early summer. Its leaves are opposite, ovate, and often have a hairy texture. Ainsliaea grossedentata thrives in moist, shaded environments and is often found in woodland areas.
